heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: There was a torrential downpour today where the rain reached a maximum intensity of 16.2mm per hour (ranked 4th in our records).  The storm lasted 3.9 hours and 8.88mm of precipitation fell during that time.  The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The record of the closest lightning strike stands at 4.97 miles on 13 May 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 13 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the ranked 10th since our records started in 23 September 2024.  There have been 6 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on 09 September 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (187°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.0°C), outside temperature (down 3.6°C), and inside temperature (down 2.1°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%) and rainfall (up 0.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 617 m), rainfall (down 0.2 mm), and light levels (up 4488 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1215 m), light levels (up 6459 lux), and rainfall (down 0.7 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 616.6m lower than yesterday, 775.2m lower than the past week, 1215.2m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 845m minimum and 3460m maximum, with an average of 970.1m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1745.3m and 2190m.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, the air will be thick and uncomfortable and very little to no wind will be present. Light to moderate rain is forecast, occasional overcast conditions, and a mix of sun and clouds. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
